capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: Managing ecological restoration projects and implementing fire management programs require efficient use of resources and a commitment to quality outcomes.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: The role involves coordinating and supervising projects, environmental assessments, and field-based activities, necessitating effective planning and prioritization skills.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Developing environmental plans and management strategies requires analytical thinking and practical solution development.

capabilities.name: Demonstrate Accountability
capabilities.description: The ranger is responsible for the conservation of natural and cultural values within parks, demonstrating accountability through adherence to legislation and policy.

capabilities.name: Manage and Develop People
capabilities.description: Working in a supportive team that values connection to Country implies a need to engage and motivate staff and develop their capabilities.

capabilities.name: Inspire Direction and Purpose
capabilities.description: Communicating goals and priorities related to the care, control, and management of the Worimi Conservation Lands.

capabilities.name: Manage Reform and Change
capabilities.description: Supporting and promoting change in land management practices in alignment with environmental and heritage obligations.

capabilities.name: Display Resilience and Courage
capabilities.description: The role requires openness and honesty in managing sensitive environmental and cultural heritage areas, and a willingness to commit to change.

capabilities.name: Act with Integrity
capabilities.description: Adhering to public sector values and professional ethics, especially in managing Aboriginal heritage and natural resources.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: Respecting diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives, especially in working closely with Traditional Owners and the Aboriginal community.

capabilities.name: Communicate Effectively
capabilities.description: Clear communication and active listening are crucial in engaging with the community and stakeholders.

capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: Collaboration with team members, Traditional Owners, and other stakeholders is essential for the role.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Effective planning, coordination, and control methods are needed for managing ecological restoration projects and fire management programs.

skills.name: Stakeholder Engagement
skills.description: Engaging with community and stakeholders to support conservation efforts and visitor experiences.

skills.name: Environmental Assessment
skills.description: Conducting environmental assessments to inform conservation strategies and management plans.

skills.name: Incident Management
skills.description: Planning and participating in field-based activities, including emergency response and law enforcement.

skills.name: Cultural Heritage Management
skills.description: Understanding and respecting the cultural significance of Worimi Country in conservation practices.

generalRole.title: Aboriginal Cultural and Environmental Ranger
generalRole.description: This role combines environmental conservation with the management of Aboriginal cultural heritage, focusing on the care, control, and management of conservation lands in collaboration with Traditional Owners and the community.
